Typhlops schmidti wilsoni Laurent, 1968
, Arnoldia ( Rhodesia ) 3(31): 2. Type locality: “Mkanda, Eastern Province , Zambia ,” ( 13.417°S , 32.833°E , elevation 1165 m ), holotype UM 9444, collected by V.J. Wilson, 17 February 1964 (preoccupied by

, of Iran );

Rhinotyphlops schmidti laurenti Wallach, 2003: 237
(replacement name for
Typhlops schmidti wilsoni Laurent, 1968
).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. Snout rounded, prominent. Rostral broad, threequarters the width of the head, truncated posteriorly; frontal subtrapezoidal; supraocular oblique, its lateral apex between nasal and preocular; eye behind the anterior border of the ocular; nasal sulcus arising from first labial; SIP T-X (N2, P, O, O), rarely II-O; MSR 22–26, reduction A/B 2 to 4, B/C 2 to 4; MD 317–374 (mean 346.1, n = 43); vertebrae 188–212 (mean 196.2, n = 25); MD/V ratio 1.66–1.85 (mean 1.75, n = 25); L/D ratio 22–49 (mean 33.2, n = 29). Dorsum dark brown to black, each scale yellow apically, venter usually immaculate, but dorsal pigmentation extends ventrally in material from eastern Zambia = A. s.
laurenti (Wallach)
. Largest specimen ( SAM 43706 — Zambia ) has a total length of 605 mm .
Distribution. Eastern Angola , southeastern Democratic Republic of the Congo , and northern Zambia , 585–1655 m ( Fig. 14 ).
